snippet: Because the annuity payment is based on how much is in the annuity, policyholders who had planned to add to their accounts will now see much smaller payments than they had expected.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column warns that insurers providing annuities are likely to follow in the footsteps of Prudential Annuities, which has barred many policyholders from making additional contributions to their accounts; contends that many of the insurers made promises to customers before the financial crisis that are now impossible to keep.
lead_paragraph: Because the annuity payment is based on how much is in the annuity, policyholders who had planned to add to their accounts will now see much smaller payments than they had expected.

headline.print_headline: A Guaranteed Return On an Annuity Has Limits After All
headline.seo: Limits on Annuity Contributions Annoy Investors
headline.main: A Guaranteed Return on an Annuity Has Limits After All
